input_text:
Job Title: Retirement Plan Loan Distribution Specialist

Location: United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Finance, Sales

Description:
Seeking: *We're seeking a dedicated individual with 2-3 years of experience in processing loans and distributions within the retirement plan landscape. *experience is required. 
You'll play a pivotal role in ensuring accurate and timely processing, resolving issues, and providing exceptional customer service, all while embracing our empathetic and growth-driven culture at The Finway Group
About Us:At The Finway Group, we're not your typical corporate America. We're a family-run business specializing in 401(k) plan administration, compliance, and retirement plan consulting. Our secret sauce? Empathy and compassion are our driving forces as we navigate the exciting journey of growth together. Why Choose The Finway Group?Join our close-knit family, where every day feels like a win. Here's why you should be a part of our tribe: 1. People First: We cover 100% of your single health, dental, life, and short-term disability premiums. Plus, we contribute $1,200 annually to your HSA. 2. Secure Future: Enjoy a 3% company contribution to your 401(k). 3. Time to Recharge: Start with 15 days of paid time off, which grows with your time here. We also throw in six paid holidays and two floating holidays. 4. Path to Success: Be part of our rapid business growth with opportunities for career advancement. 5. Work-Life Balance: Flexible hours within industry standards ensure you can maintain a healthy balance. 6. Dress Comfortably: Our office rocks a business casual dress code, with jeans allowed. Our Culture:Join our family-oriented culture where hard work, determination, and being the best at what we do are celebrated. At The Finway Group, we're all about investing in your future. If you're ready to make that investment, we're ready to welcome you with open arms. Your Role:As a Retirement Plan Loan and Distribution Specialist, your responsibilities will include:
-Ensuring timely and accurate processing of distributions and loans - Resolving issues as they pertain to distribution and loan processing - Assisting participants as needed to ensure their requests are handled appropriately - Learning different vendors’ websites to approve online requests and run reports when needed - Understanding plan document language in order to ensure proper handling of requests Qualifications:To thrive in our family atmosphere, you should bring:- Preferred minimum of 2-3 years of experience with retirement plan documents- Outstanding verbal and written communication skills for top-notch customer service.- Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications, including Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.- A keen eye for detail, compliance, and accuracy.- Typical work hours: Monday through Friday, approximately 8:00 am to 5:00 pm. If you're passionate about the retirement industry and want to be part of a team where empathy and compassion drive our success, apply now for the Retirement Plan Customer Service Associate position at The Finway Group. Join us and be part of something truly special.

Experience Level (if available): None

output_json.title: Retirement Plan Loan Distribution Specialist
output_json.summary: Seeking an experienced individual for a full-time position at The Finway Group.
soft_skills: Outstanding verbal and written communication skills
job_responsibilities: Ensuring timely and accurate processing of distributions and loans
Resolving issues related to distribution and loan processing
Learning different vendors’ websites to approve online requests and run reports
benefits: Covering 100% of single health, dental, life, and short-term disability premiums
15 days of paid time off growing with time
Six paid holidays and two floating holidays
Business casual dress code with jeans allowed
output_json.company_information: The Finway Group specializes in 401(k) plan administration, compliance, and retirement plan consulting.

other.content: Covering 100% of single health, dental, life, and short-term disability premiums; Annual contribution of $1,200 to HSA; 3% company contribution to 401(k); 15 days of paid time off growing with time; Six paid holidays and two floating holidays; Opportunities for career advancement; Flexible hours within industry standards; Business casual dress code with jeans allowed.
